doc:
Baby Bunny Smith https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Baby_Bunny_Smith 0 Helen "Baby Bunny" Smith (1888–1951), was an American actress and sideshow performer. She made her living traveling with sideshows in the early 20th century billed as a circus fat lady. She was born in Portland, Oregon in April 1888. Despite a normal childhood she became very heavy during grammar school. She left school and took a job as a sideshow performer at the age of 13. Her weight ballooned to as much as 500 lbs. She became known as "Baby Bunny Smith" during her sideshow career. She met her husband, 58 lb Peter Robinson, a fellow sideshow performer known and billed as "the human skeleton", while filming the cult classic Freaks. They had two children. Smith was diagnosed as hypothyroid in 1951 and died shortly after of a heart attack. Helen_"_Baby_Bunny_"_Smith ( 1888 – 1951 ) , was an_American_actress_and_sideshow_performer . She made her_living traveling with sideshows in the_early_20th_century billed as a_circus_fat_lady . She was_born in Portland , Oregon in April_1888 . Despite a_normal_childhood she became very_heavy during grammar_school . She left school and took a_job as a_sideshow_performer at the_age of 13 . Her_weight ballooned to as_much_as_500_lbs . She became known as " Baby_Bunny_Smith " during her_sideshow_career . She met her_husband , 58_lb_Peter_Robinson , a_fellow_sideshow_performer known_and_billed as " the_human_skeleton_" , while filming the_cult_classic_Freaks . They had two_children . Smith was_diagnosed as hypothyroid in 1951 and died shortly after_of a_heart_attack .
